results.title: The Dame Was Loaded for DOS
results.creator_credit: Philips Interactive Media, Inc. and Beam Software
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. Two CD-ROM, CD case insert and manual in 2 CD capacity jewel case
results.brief_description:
A hardboiled detective, femme Fatales, missing people and money. The Dame was Loaded has all the hardboiled elements of film noir and is just as cinematic.

Created using innovative Full Motion Video (FMV) technology, which was developed in-house at Beam Software, this point-and-click adventure incorporated real footage of actors that players interact with to solve the mystery. At the time when computer graphics were limited, PMV games tried to generate empathy in players by putting them in the protagonist’s point of view and presenting other characters as real people in a fully realised game world.

When it was made it was the largest multimedia production in Australia, with game developers collaborating closely with actors and film crews, who used iconic Melbourne landmarks as settings like the art-deco former police headquarters on Russell Street.

results.title: The Dambusters
results.creator_credit: Assocaited British Picture Corp and Michael Anderson
results.brief_description: An epic World War II story. Scientist Dr. Barnes Wallis believes World War II can be shortened by destroying the Ruhr dams, thus paralysing the German’s industrial nerve centre. In spite of the difficulties caused by the critical situation at the time, he works steadily to perfect a special bomb of his own invention for the purpose. Air Ace, Wing Commander Guy Gibson is chosen to form, train and lead the hand-picked squadron who will drop the bomb. Flying at tree-top level they cross the Rhine and attack the first dam - Moehne. The bombers seem unable to maintain the accuracy essential for success - then suddenly the masonry begins to crumble. Starring Richard Todd, Michael Redgrave and Basil Sydney . Based on the novel by Paul Brickhill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Assocaited British Picture Corp and Michael Anderson

results.title: The Dam builders: beavers and man
results.creator_credit: L. Richard Ellison, National Educational Television and Time-Life Broadcast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World We Live In”.
A comparison of the ecological changes brought about by the dam building activities of two species of mammals - humans and the beaver. It shows that all life is interdependent and points out how humans are damaging the ecological balance of nature whereas the beaver, although bringing change to its area, is not. Shows beavers in north America and engineers in Africa. Narrated by Joseph Julian.

results.title: The Dam builders
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the Melbourne water supply system and the efforts of the MMBW to create enjoyable environments such as landscaping and recreation facilities in several catchment areas. Highlights the construction of the Cardinia Reservoir, near Emerald, now the largest storage area for Melbourne.

results.title: The Dam at Nagarjunasagar
results.creator_credit: Equinox Films, Carousel Films and Gene Leashinger
results.brief_description: South of Hyderabad, India, astride the mighty Krishna river, stands the most massive masonry dam ever constructed. In an architectural feat which parallels the building of Egypt’s Pyramids, 30,000 men, women and children worked day and night for 14 years to complete it. Nagarjunasagar is three miles across, 400 feet high and forms one of the largest man-made lakes in the world.

results.title: The Dalai Lama of Tibet
results.creator_credit: Austin Steele, John Walsh and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
The Dalai Lama answers questions at a press conference in Perth as part of his Australian tour. He discusses his philosophy of compassion in relation to conflict and political struggle, with particular reference to the Chinese invasion of Tibet. He also provides a brief outline of the events arising from the Chinese invasion. The Dalai Lama is the spiritual leader of the Tibetan people and an inspiration to thousands around the world. He has been living in exile since 1959.

results.title: The Dairy farm
results.brief_description: In this film we visit a mid-western American dairy farm; we watch the farmer engaged in feeding his cattle, milking the cows, preparing the milk for marketing, and such seasonal operations as cultivating, haying, and storing fodder in the silo.
results.description: In this film we visit a mid-western American dairy farm; we watch the farmer engaged in feeding his cattle, milking the cows, preparing the milk for marketing, and such seasonal operations as cultivating, haying, and storing fodder in the silo.

results.title: The Daily Show
results.brief_description: During the time of the protests, many late night TV shows reported on the protests, including The Daily Show while Jon Stewart was host. During the segment, Samantha Bee took a humourous approach and satirised participants.

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

results.description: During the time of the protests, many late night TV shows reported on the protests, including The Daily Show while Jon Stewart was host. During the segment, Samantha Bee took a humourous approach and satirised participants.

results.title: The Daily routine (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: A High, Self Production, Thomas Nielson and Charles Silverman
results.brief_description: Shows how organising the routine of the day in the primary school aids teachers’ curriculum and cognitive goals, and how a consistent routine allows children to predict the sequence of events, experience different time lengths and the concepts of beginning, middle and end. The film also illustrates how activities and drama during specific times of the day reinforce cognitive goals.
